result.execSummary:
The defendant Bacilio Miguel Mejia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs (including any domestic abuse surcharge that may be imposed. Provide DNA sample if one has not already been given- pay surcharge.
The Court ordered restitution set at $0.00.  The Court ordered that all financial obligations and/or restitution be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any other time being served with credit for 118 days served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED or HSED.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers or drug houses).
No contact with victim as specified in the criminal complaint.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Mental health assessment and any follow-up care and treatment that is deemed appropriate.
Take any and all medications as prescribed, only in the manner prescribed by a treating physician.
Participate in Batter's Intervention programming.
Participate in Anger Management programming.

Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bacilio Miguel Mejia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bacilio Miguel Mejia in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Bacilio Miguel Mejia in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Negotiations placed on the record.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Bacilio Miguel Mejia not in court, in custody.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Bacilio Miguel Mejia not in court, in custody.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense needs additional time to review offer with the defendant; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court orders other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED to $350.00 CASH.

Defendant Bacilio Miguel Mejia in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Bacilio Miguel Mejia in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
FILED, NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL
FILED, NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with:  Yolanda C.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bacilio Miguel Mejia in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  
Defendant Bacilio Miguel Mejia in custody.  
Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
